assessment.title: South African Green Party Policy Platform

question.scenario: It is the year 2034. After years of campaigning, the South African Green Party has become a strong political force, positioning itself as the official opposition to the ruling party.
question.task: As leader of the Green Party, write an opinion piece outlining the ecological solutions your party proposes for South Africa.
requirements: Show how ecological thinking can help address both environmental challenges (e.g., biodiversity loss, climate change, ecosystem degradation) and socio-economic issues (e.g., inequality, unemployment, food and water security) facing South Africans in the 2030s.
Integrate ecological theory, biodiversity concepts, and examples from South Africa and globally.
Avoid vague or generic statements such as 'plant trees', 'educate people', or 'develop policies'.
Ensure the socio-economic connection is covered, and show clear links to ecological theory such as IPBES concepts.
constraints: Must demonstrate political voice and persuasive writing
Requires integration of scientific concepts with policy proposals
Should address South African context specifically

criteria.name: Ecological Solutions Proposed
criteria.description: Quality and specificity of ecological interventions

scoring_bands.descriptor: Specific ecological solutions, but limited explanation (renewables, restoration, sustainable farming).
Multiple, well-developed ecological solutions grounded in theory (ecosystem services, biodiversity resilience, conservation planning).

criteria.name: Link to Socio-Economic Problems
criteria.description: Integration of ecological solutions with social and economic challenges

scoring_bands.descriptor: Mentions jobs/food/water but weakly tied to ecology.
Strong integration: shows how ecological solutions (e.g., restoring catchments, renewable energy, agroecology) address unemployment, inequality, and security.
indicators: Clear causal mechanisms linking ecology to social outcomes
Specific examples of how environmental solutions create economic opportunities
Recognition of justice and equity dimensions

criteria.name: Use of Ecological Theory & Course Material
criteria.description: Application of theoretical frameworks and course concepts

indicators: Purely political rhetoric without scientific backing

scoring_bands.descriptor: Clear application of theory (e.g., species–area, α/β/γ-diversity, resilience theory).
indicators: Theory used to justify policy positions

criteria.name: Structure & Persuasiveness
criteria.description: Quality of argumentation and opinion piece format

scoring_bands.descriptor: Clear, logical, compelling opinion piece with an ecological voice.

grading_instructions.approach: Evaluate integration of ecological science with political discourse and policy solutions
assessment_priorities: Integration of environmental and social justice concerns
red_flags: Generic environmental slogans without scientific backing
Failure to connect environmental and social issues
Weak political voice or unconvincing policy platform
excellence_indicators: Sophisticated integration of multiple ecological theories
Clear pathways from ecological solutions to socio-economic benefits
Strong South African examples and context
Compelling political narrative with scientific credibility
Recognition of complex socio-ecological system dynamics

content_requirements: What was done well/correctly in relation to this criterion
What was incorrect, missing, or inadequately addressed

suggested_improvements.heading: Suggested improvements
suggested_improvements.content: Single paragraph outlining specific steps the student can take to improve their answer
suggested_improvements.focus: Actionable advice for enhancing integration of ecological science with political policy development

final_mark.calculation: Sum of all criterion marks converted to percentage out of 25 total marks

feedback_sequence: Criterion 1: Ecological Solutions Proposed feedback (2 paragraphs max) + mark out of 10
Criterion 2: Link to Socio-Economic Problems feedback (2 paragraphs max) + mark out of 7
Criterion 3: Use of Ecological Theory & Course Material feedback (2 paragraphs max) + mark out of 5
Criterion 4: Structure & Persuasiveness feedback (2 paragraphs max) + mark out of 3

special_considerations.political_voice_assessment: Evaluate authenticity of political discourse while maintaining scientific rigor standards
special_considerations.south_african_context: Specifically address whether student demonstrates understanding of local environmental and socio-economic challenges
special_considerations.opinion_piece_format: Assess whether response successfully adopts persuasive opinion piece structure rather than academic essay format
